emerging_technologies.name: Decentralized AI Training
emerging_technologies.description: Using blockchain to decentralize AI model training, enhancing privacy and reducing computational costs.
emerging_technologies.societal_implications: Could democratize AI development, potentially reducing monopolies in AI tech but raising concerns about AI ethics.
emerging_technologies.adoption_factors: Adoption depends on the development of efficient blockchain networks and the acceptance of decentralized models by AI developers.

emerging_technologies.name: XVI Token Ecosystem
emerging_technologies.description: Expansion of the XVI token for broader use in technology investment, governance, and as a utility token within tech ecosystems.
emerging_technologies.societal_implications: Could lead to new investment models in tech, potentially reducing entry barriers but might also introduce market volatility.
emerging_technologies.adoption_factors: Requires regulatory clarity, widespread adoption in tech hubs, and integration with existing financial systems.

emerging_technologies.name: Neural Lace
emerging_technologies.description: A mesh of tiny electrodes that can be injected into the brain to interface with neurons, enhancing human cognitive abilities.
emerging_technologies.societal_implications: Ethical concerns regarding privacy, identity, and inequality in access to technology enhancements.
emerging_technologies.adoption_factors: Requires significant advancements in biocompatibility, safety, and public acceptance of brain-computer interfaces.

emerging_technologies.name: Autonomous Spacecraft Swarms
emerging_technologies.description: Fleets of small, self-organizing spacecraft for planetary exploration or large-scale satellite constellations.
emerging_technologies.societal_implications: Could revolutionize space missions but also increase space debris and potential for space traffic management issues.
emerging_technologies.adoption_factors: Dependent on advancements in autonomous AI, miniaturization of space tech, and international space law.

mainstream_technologies.name: AI-Powered Autonomous Vehicles
mainstream_technologies.description: Full-scale deployment of self-driving cars using advanced AI for navigation and safety.
mainstream_technologies.adoption_status: Wide adoption in urban areas with necessary infrastructure; regulatory hurdles remain for full global adoption.

mainstream_technologies.name: Solid-State Batteries
mainstream_technologies.description: Next-generation batteries with higher energy densities, faster charging, and enhanced safety.
mainstream_technologies.adoption_status: Becoming standard in electric vehicles and grid storage, driven by demand for better energy solutions.

epoch_themes.description: Shifting control from centralized entities to distributed systems through technology.
epoch_themes.societal_impact: Promotes transparency and reduces monopolistic control but introduces new governance challenges.
epoch_themes.global_trends: Increasing demand for data sovereignty, financial democratization, and distributed computing.

epoch_themes.description: Enhancement of human capabilities through technology integration.
epoch_themes.societal_impact: Potential for increased productivity and cognitive enhancement but raises ethical questions about human identity.
epoch_themes.global_trends: Growing interest in transhumanism, biohacking, and personal enhancement technologies.
